titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Operations, Vice President, Office Files of John Colborn
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Operations, Vice President, Office Files of John Colborn FA1377

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-11-01 04:28:09 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Operations, Vice President, Office Files of John Colborn

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at the RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files, and officers' papers were transferred to and accessioned by the RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.
This material was transferred to the RAC in four accessions between 2020 and 2023 and was ingested by the RAC as Accessions 2020:027, 2021:139, 2022:054, 2023:053.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the office files John Colborn created when he worked at the Ford Foundation. Files are included from Colborn's positions in the Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS) Economic Development unit, Office of Program Management, and Operations. Colborn was a Program Officer and then Deputy Director of the ASSETS Economic Development unit, Director of Program Operations in the Office of Program Management, and then finished at the Foundation as Vice President of Operations.

The collection is comprised of two series. Subject files documenting Colborn's management of the ASSETS Economic Development unit's workforce development portfolio and his later program strategy work as Operations Vice President are contained in the first series. The second series contains notebooks Colborn created when he served as Operations Vice President.

The bulk of the collection's materials concern the Community College Bridges to Opportunities Initiative (CCBOI), a joint project by ASSETS and the Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program (KCF) that was tied to Colborn's workforce development programming. CCBOI and other components of Colborn's work focused on building career pathways, adult learning, low wage workers, skills training, education reform, and state policy for community colleges.
Common material formats found throughout the collection include correspondence, meeting materials, notes, drafts, reports, proposals, memos, articles, and publications.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is comprised of two series.
Original order was maintained as much as possible. Notebooks in series 2 were arranged by date.
The collection arrangement is as follows:

did.unittitle: Subject files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains the subject files John Colborn created and maintained when he worked at the Ford Foundation. Most of the files regard Colborn's work as a Program Officer and later Deputy Director of the Asset Building and Community Development Program (ASSETS), Economic Development unit. A few files show how Colborn continued to support some of the projects he started in the Economic Development unit when he transitioned to become Director of Program Operations in the Office of Program Management. There are some materials at the end of the series that Colborn created when he served as Vice President of Operations at the Foundation.

Colborn's activities in the Economic Development unit focused on workforce development. Drafts, copies, and materials related to Colborn's Assignment Memo, Program Officer Memo, Reflection Memos, and Exit/Transition Memo describe the purpose, scope, and progress of his workforce development portfolio. The Community College Bridges to Opportunity Initiative (CCBOI) and the Sectoral Workforce Development Initiative were two of the main projects of Colborn's workforce development programming.

Most of the files in the series concern the CCBOI. There are files regarding CCBOI meetings, grantees, and evaluations. Other records document the planning of the initiative and its evolution from the Workforce Education Development Initiative (WEDI) and regard grantmaking for community colleges through groups like the Community College Affinity Partnership (CCAP).

The files Colborn created as Vice President of Operations generally concern the program strategy of the Economic Opportunity and Assets Program (EOA) and a Fiscal Year 2011 strategic review for the program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains 13 notebooks John Colborn created through his activities working at the Ford Foundation. The notebooks do not have labels describing the dates they cover. Date information was gathered and inferred from the content of the notebooks. Colborn used these notebooks when he served as Vice President of Operations at the Foundation from 2010 to 2013.

Colborn used the notebooks for meetings and program strategy. A few other items were inserted into the notebooks like other notes and business cards. The notebooks were arranged by date during processing.
